perturbation.changed_text:
AND
ScanSource, Inc., a company incorporated in South Carolina, with its registered office at 6 Logue Court, Greenville, South Carolina 29615
("ScanSource").
ScanSource Latin America, Inc. a ScanSource Affiliate incorporated in Florida, whose registered business address is 1935 NW 87 Avenue, Miami,

SCANSOURCE DE MEXICO S. DE R.L. DE C.V., a ScanSource Affiliate incorporated in Mexico, whose registered business address is Calle 4 No.
298, Colonia Franccionamiento Industrial Alce Blanco, Naucalpan de Juarez, Estado de México 53370 ("ScanSource Mexico")
(Collectively "Distributor Group')
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines the collective of ScanSource entities as "Distributor". The modified text changes this to "Distributor Group". Later references to "Distributor" will now be ambiguous, as it's unclear if it refers to the entire group or just ScanSource, Inc.

perturbation.original_text:
1.
Issuance and Acceptance of Purchase Order. To order the Xplore Products, Distributor shall place a purchase order via sending an email to
xpldistributors@zebra.com. Each purchase order shall specify the bill-to address, ship-to address, quantity and description of each Xplore
Product ordered, the unit price for each Xplore Product, the requested ship date, the preferred means of delivery, and tax-exempt
certifications, if any. Orders received without this information or which contain any discrepancy may be returned to Distributor for
completion or revision as applicable. Each purchase order placed by Distributor, as well as each invoice sent by Xplore, shall be governed by
the terms of this Addendum and the Distribution Agreement and any additional or different terms within the purchase order or invoice shall
have no effect. Each purchase order for the Xplore Products shall be subject to Xplore’s acceptance and, upon acceptance, Xplore shall
confirm the purchase order and the Estimated Shipping Date with Distributor. Notwithstanding such acceptance, Xplore reserves the right
where necessary to amend the Orders including without limitation part numbers, special pricing and Estimated Shipping Date, and may at its
sole discretion require an amended Order from Distributor incorporating such changes. For the purposes of this Exhibit B, “Estimated
Shipping Date” shall mean the estimated shipping date of an accepted purchase order.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.
Issuance and Acceptance of Purchase Order. To order the Xplore Products, Distributor Group shall place a purchase order via sending an email to
xpldistributors@zebra.com. Each purchase order shall specify the bill-to address, ship-to address, quantity and description of each Xplore
Product ordered, the unit price for each Xplore Product, the requested ship date, the preferred means of delivery, and tax-exempt
certifications, if any. Orders received without this information or which contain any discrepancy may be returned to Distributor for
completion or revision as applicable. Each purchase order placed by Distributor, as well as each invoice sent by Xplore, shall be governed by
the terms of this Addendum and the Distribution Agreement and any additional or different terms within the purchase order or invoice shall
have no effect. Each purchase order for the Xplore Products shall be subject to Xplore’s acceptance and, upon acceptance, Xplore shall
confirm the purchase order and the Estimated Shipping Date with Distributor Group. Notwithstanding such acceptance, Xplore reserves the right
where necessary to amend the Orders including without limitation part numbers, special pricing and Estimated Shipping Date, and may at its
sole discretion require an amended Order from Distributor incorporating such changes. For the purposes of this Exhibit B, “Estimated
Shipping Date” shall mean the estimated shipping date of an accepted purchase order.
perturbation.explanation: The original text uses both "Distributor" and "Distributor Group." By interchanging these terms in the same paragraph, it becomes unclear who is responsible for placing the purchase orders and receiving confirmations, leading to potential disputes.  The term "Distributor Group" places the obligation on all named parties, where only ScanSource, Inc. might be responsible.

perturbation.original_text:
4.
Stock on Hand. Distributor shall use commercially reasonable efforts to maintain thirty (30) days of stock in Distributor’s inventory to
support sales. Xplore acknowledges that from time to time, Distributor’s inventory levels may fall below the thirty (30) days goal that is
agreed upon by both Parties. If inventory levels fall below the thirty (30) day goal for more than sixty (60) consecutive days, Xplore, upon
written notice to Distributor, shall replenish the stock to an amount agreed by both Parties.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.
Stock on Hand. Distributor shall use commercially reasonable efforts to maintain thirty (30) days of stock in ScanSource's inventory to
support sales. Xplore acknowledges that from time to time, Distributor’s inventory levels may fall below the thirty (30) days goal that is
agreed upon by both Parties. If inventory levels fall below the thirty (30) day goal for more than sixty (60) consecutive days, Xplore, upon
written notice to Distributor Group, shall replenish the stock to an amount agreed by both Parties.
perturbation.explanation: The first sentence states that the Distributor must maintain stock in ScanSource's inventory. The third sentence says that if inventory levels fall below a goal, Xplore will notify the Distributor Group. This creates an internal contradiction. The Distributor may interpret that only ScanSource, Inc.'s inventory counts towards the stock levels, relieving its affiliates. Xplore, on the other hand, may expect stock levels of all "Distributor Group" entities to be aggregated. The written notice to the "Distributor Group" puts the other ScanSource companies on notice for something that is not expected of them.
